___text.description: The content of the opened text document.

___version.description:
The version number of this document (it will strictly increase after each

change, including undo/redo).

___textDocument.description: The document to request code lens for.

___resolveProvider.description: Code lens has a resolve provider as well.

_88ServerCapabilities.description:
Defines the capabilities provided by a language

server.

___documentSymbolProvider.description: The server provides document symbol support.

___documentHighlightProvider.description: The server provides document highlight support.

___textDocumentSync.description: Defines how text documents are synced.

___firstTriggerCharacter.description: A character on which formatting should be triggered, like `}`.

___documentOnTypeFormattingProvider.description: The server provides document formatting on typing.

___triggerCharacters.description: The characters that trigger completion automatically.

___resolveProvider.description:
The server provides support to resolve additional

information for a completion item.
Code lens has a resolve provider as well.

___triggerCharacters.description:
The characters that trigger signature help

automatically.

___signatureHelpProvider.description: The server provides signature help support.

___definitionProvider.description: The server provides goto definition support.

___workspaceSymbolProvider.description: The server provides workspace symbol support.

___referencesProvider.description: The server provides find references support.

___documentRangeFormattingProvider.description: The server provides document range formatting.

___resolveProvider.description: Document links have a resolve provider as well.

___documentLinkProvider.description: The server provides document link support.

___diagnostics.description: An array of diagnostic information items.

___code.description: The diagnostic's code. Can be omitted.

___severity.description:
The diagnostic's severity. Can be omitted. If omitted it is up to the

client to interpret diagnostics as error, warning, info or hint.

___range.description: The range at which the message applies

___source.description:
A human-readable string describing the source of this

diagnostic, e.g. 'typescript' or 'super lint'.

items.description:
Represents a diagnostic, such as a compiler error or warning. Diagnostic objects

are only valid in the scope of a resource.

The Diagnostic namespace provides helper functions to work with

[Diagnostic](#Diagnostic) literals.

___uri.description: The URI for which diagnostic information is reported.

___version.description: The version number of this document.

___tabSize.description: Size of a tab in spaces.

___resolveProvider.description: Document links have a resolve provider as well.

items.description: An event describing a file change.

___triggerCharacters.description:
The characters that trigger signature help

automatically.

_88ClientCapabilities.description: Defines the capabilities provided by the client.

The version number of this document (it will strictly increase after each

change, including undo/redo).

___textDocument.description: The document in which the command was invoked.

$eref.description:
A range in a text document expressed as (zero-based) start and end positions.

The Range namespace provides helper functions to work with

[Range](#Range) literals.

___range.description: The range for which the command was invoked.

___actions.description: The message action items to present.

___title.description: A short title like 'Retry', 'Open Log' etc.

___newName.description:
The new name of the symbol. If the given name is not valid the

request must return a [ResponseError](#ResponseError) with an

appropriate message set.

___character.description: Character offset on a line in a document (zero-based).

___position.description: The position at which this request was send.

items.description:
An event describing a change to a text document. If range and rangeLength are omitted

the new text is considered to be the full content of the document.

___version.description: The version number of this document.

___textDocument.description:
The document that did change. The version number points

to the version after all provided content changes have

been applied.

___processId.description:
The process Id of the parent process that started

the server.

___trace.description: The initial trace setting. If omitted trace is disabled ('off').

___rootPath.description:
The rootPath of the workspace. Is null

if no folder is open.
